definition: a mental illness that causes a strong desire to set fire to things
a mental illness in which somebody has a strong desire, which they cannot control, to steal things
a fear of being in public places where there are many other people
to move a train or a coach of a train from one track to another
to move somebody/something to a different place, especially a less important one
a small container, usually made of glass, containing a drug that will be used for an injection
a small glass container, for medicine or perfume
an act of injecting somebody with a drug or other substance
a large sum of money that is spent to help improve a situation, business, etc.
an act of forcing a liquid or other substance into something
a condition in which the brain becomes swollen (= larger than normal), caused by an infection or allergic reaction
if you exude a particular feeling or quality, or it exudes from you, people can easily see that you have it
if something exudes a liquid or smell, or a liquid or smell exudes from somewhere, the liquid, etc. comes out slowly
not following one style or set of ideas but choosing from or using a wide variety
a type of job that needs special training or skill, especially one that needs a high level of education
all the people who work in a particular type of profession
the traditional jobs that need a high level of education and training, such as being a doctor or a lawyer
a statement about what you believe, feel or think about something, that is sometimes made publicly
the condition of having lost too much water from your body
the process of removing water from something
to move your body into a lower position by bending one or both knees, as a sign of respect in a church
to show too much respect to somebody/something

a simple form of a language, especially English, Portuguese or Dutch, with a limited number of words, that are used together with words from a local language. It is used when people who do not speak the same language need to talk to each other.
a Creole language based on English, used in Papua New Guinea
a way of speaking a language that uses simple words and forms, used when a person does not speak the language well, or when talking to somebody who does not speak the language well
the fact of being frequently away from work or school, especially without good reasons
a substance that causes an increase in the flow of urine
formal release from blame for doing something wrong
a formal statement that a person is forgiven for what they have done wrong
a thick yellow or green liquid that is produced in a wound as a result of an infection
containing or producing pus
a small raised red spot on the skin
to remove salt from seawater so that it can be used
to state formally that somebody is not guilty or responsible for something
to give absolution to somebody
a person whose marriage has been legally ended, especially a woman
the woman that somebody is engaged to
the man that somebody is engaged to
able to take in something easily, especially liquid
an act of choosing not to use a vote either in favour of or against something
the act of not allowing yourself to have or do something fun or something that is considered bad
